content:
Yes, Johnson & Johnson has set some greenhouse gas (GHG) emission reduction targets in the near future. The company has set a goal to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, covering both its operations and products. To achieve this goal, Johnson & Johnson has established specific targets to reduce its GHG emissions by 20% by 2025, compared to the 2010 baseline. 

Additionally, the company has set specific emissions reduction targets for its Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions, categorizing emissions from its own operations, energy suppliers, and end-use of products, respectively. Johnson & Johnson aims to achieve a 35% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions and a 20% reduction in Scope 3 emissions by 2030, compared to the 2010 baseline.

These are some of the GHG emission reduction targets Johnson & Johnson has set for the near future. The company is committed to continually improving its environmental performance and contributing to global efforts to mitigate and adapt to climate change.
